alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Somerset, southeastern Wicomico and west central Worcester Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salisbury, Fruitland, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Salisbury University, Newark, Parsonsburg, Pittsville, Whitehaven, Trinity, Salisbury-Wicomico, Eden, Allen, Lakewood, Widgeon, Longridge, Chesapeake Heights, Powellville, Melson and Whiton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
